page.title: 12Introduction continued
page.content: significant historic remains are Roman. The largest amphitheatre in Britian was excavated in 1924 by Sir Mortimer Wheeler, and the foundation of the fortress barracks stand close by. 1985 was a significant year for Caerleon, because it saw the opening of the Roman fortress baths after 10 years of painstaking archaelogical excavation. Caerleon now is a thriving expanding township which retains a unique atmosphere and sense of history. It is a very popular residential area nd most of its expansion is in housing development. There is litte industry in the area and most people travel to surround larger towns to work. It has good sporting and education facilities some thriving clubs and a community centre.
